titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Photograph Album Collection LSC.0094
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by UCLA Library Special Collections staff; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cub√© and edited by Josh Fiala.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 2019 August 2.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-09-30 12:09:20 -0700.

did.abstract: This collection, like Picture Collection 99 , contains photographs etc. of both persons and places and is intended as a supplement to other collections in the Department. It contains both bound and boxed sets of photographs which are too bulky to be located with Picture Collection 99 .
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Photograph Album collection (Collection Number 94). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by UCLA Library Special Collections staff.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of thousands of photographs, some with descriptions and titled albums. California, Latin America, and the Middle East are well represented. Other subjects include railroad locomotives, photographs of British soldiers in the 1860s, South Africa, French actress Constant Coquelin, Australia, Egypt, Italy, Queen Victoria's 1897 Diamond Jubilee, the Canadian Rockies, Texas oil fields, Mexican Revolution, Mathew Brady photographs of soldiers and civilians, Abraham Lincoln, China, France, photographs of architectural drawings, New Zealand, Fiji, Persia, Scotland, Burma, Athens, Philippines, St. Petersburg, Japan, Hawaii, Sakhalin snow crystals, Dutch East Indies, Hopi Indians, West Indies, Turkey, Vatican sculptures, World War I photographs from France and Belgium, U.S. Navy midshipmen in the 1860s, pictures of people involved in the French Commune of 1871, and photographs of London.

did.unittitle: California Development Company photographs. v.p. (California & Arizona).
did.physdesc: (2 boxes of Disbound albums with mounted photographs)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Showing irrigation work of California Development Company along the Colorado River and in the Imperial Valley, and the effects of the water flowing through the Colorado River Crevasse into the Salton Sink.

did.unittitle: Mulholland Highway, city of Los Angeles, Board of Public Works, D.L. Reaburn, construction engineer. Book no.2.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Collection of mounted photographs of Somaliland at time of Italo-Ethiopian War, 1935-1936[?].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Collection of mounted photographs of Eretrea at time of Italo-Ethiopian War, 1935-1936[?].

did.unittitle: Illustrations for Pioneer days in Kern County by Arthur S. Crites.
did.physdesc: (1 vol., unpaged looseleaf notebook with 43 original photographs and 4 maps)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pioneer days in Kern County by Arthur S. Crites. Los Angeles: Ward Ritchie Press, 1951.

did.unittitle: The company's rolling stock and buildings.
Locomotives belonging to various railroads in the United States and Canada.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A collection of views of homes, buildings and proposed land development in these communities by S.H. Woodruff, Community Developer. Included are views of the French and Italian Rivieras, apparently as possible models for Dana Point.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Printed in Germany"

did.unittitle: Hand-colored [photographs]. [San Francisco and Los Angeles, Pacific Novelty Company].
[Scrapbook of photographs taken by Lummis in New Mexico and Southern California].

did.unittitle: [Virginia Picture album] [Old Point Comfort, Virginia, J.B. Kimberly].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Note on album cover: (San Fernando Valley?); tentatively identified as Paso Robles by a relative of Whitley, 1987.

did.unittitle: [Early photographs of San Diego, California and Coronado Beach].
A trip to the Pacific Northwest via Southern Pacific Railroad.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Among the identified photographs are Views of San Diego Bay, Hotel del Coronoado, DuBois residence in Riverside, Moqui squaws, San Juan Capistrano mission, San Luis Rey mission, San Luis Obispo, Indian wood carrier, San Diego mission, view from Villa Hotel in Redlands, Mojave Indians, and Santa Barbara mission.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: vol.1) "Photographic Experiments, 1850-1851" by an unidentified photographer; castles and churches in the style of Fox-Talbot.

vol.2) Album of Alfred Capel Cure with his bookplate, quite likely his own work. In addition to views of his home, Blake Hall, Essex, there are views of English and Irish buildings, portraits of Irish villagers and of Cure and his camera.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Many of the calotypes are faded.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Many portraits are identified.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Ex-libris: Mrs. L.C. Winchester, Elgin, Illinois.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Unidentified.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p:
Photographs include various scenes in Southern California, Arizona and New Mexico.
1. Arrowhead Hot Springs, California -- Views.
2. Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe Railroad -- Views.
3. Canyon Diablo, Arizona -- Views.
4. Flagstaff, Arizona -- Views.
5. Fort Wingate, New Mexico -- Views.
6. Gallup, New Mexico -- Views.
7. Hesperia, California -- Views.
8. Highland, California --Views.
9. Indians of North America -- Southwest, New -- Views.
10. Laguna, New Mexico -- Views.
11. Los Angeles -- Views.
12. Lowe, Montana -- Views.
13. Ontario, California -- Views.
14. Pasadena, California -- Views.
15. Rancho Camulos, Ventura County, California -- Views.
16. Rancho Santa Anita, Los Angeles, County, California -- Views.
17. Redlands, California -- Views.
18. Redondo Beach, California -- Views.
19. Riverside, California -- Views.
20. San Bernardino Mountains -- Views.
21. San Diego, California -- Views.
22. San Gabriel Mountains -- Views.
23. San Jacinto, California -- Views.
24. San Juan Capistrano, California -- Views.
25. San Juan Capistrano mission, California -- Views.
26. Santa Catalina Island, California -- Views.
27. Santa Monica, California -- Views.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views are mostly of South Africa but also include St. Helena (Island) and Madeira.

scopecontent.p: Most of the postcards are addressed to various persons in Los Angeles and Santa Ana. Views are chiefly of Southern California and San Francisco Bay Area cities.

did.unittitle: Views of manufacture and installations of product. Los Angeles.

scopecontent.p: Marbelite Corporation was a manufacturer of street lighting equipment.

scopecontent.p: Made exclusively for the Van Noy News Company, Denver, Colorado; for sale only en route on the Denver & Rio Grande railroad (Denver: Smith-Brooks Printing Company, c.1913).

did.unittitle: Postcard views of the Mexican Revolution along the U.S. border.

Trip photographs from a small city in Texas to Mexico, including portraits of children, women, Blacks, horse-drawn carriages, houses, churches, street scenes, and panoramic views of Mexican towns.

Abraham Lincoln from the Frederick Hill Meserve Collection. New York.
did.physdesc: (1 album of photographs with 132 ports, 28 cm.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Prepared by Meserve for Ralph A. Gregory of Saint Louis, Missouri. Included are lists identifying the photographs and letters from Meserve to Gregory.
Descriptions of 118 of these portraits will be found in Meserve's The photographic portraits of Abraham Lincoln (TR 16.5 L6M5).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Showing French church interiors and exteriors. Woodcarving work, interior furnishings and church courtyard views are also included.

did.physdesc: (1 vol., 35.5 √ó 22 cm. Photograph album decorated with small watercolors)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inscribed on front cover, To Sir William Birt, January, 1897. Photographs show rolling stock and the shops engaged in its production at Stratford Works. Included are many pages of signatures.

did.unittitle: San Francisco earthquake and fire. San Francisco.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A collection of amateur snapshots showing the military, the streets and the people in the aftermath of the 1906 earthquake.

did.physdesc: (1 item. 22 √ó 20 cm. Padded tan suede photograph album with brass corners and hasp)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A gift album with group and individual photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Containing many carte-de-visite, portraits and some large group photographs probably taken at Oxford.

did.unittitle: Southern California Edison Company, Long Beach steam plant. Long Beach, California.
did.physdesc: (4 items. 26 √ó 35 cm. Photograph albums with approximately 500 [8 √ó 10"] photographs)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Showing the construction of Steam Plants no.1-3. The plants were designed by Stone & Webster, Incorporated, Boston. Bishop was official photographer for the company from 1920-1930.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Among the photographs is one of David Curry, founder of Camp Curry.

did.unittitle: European royalty and nobility portraits. v.p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views of cities and tourist attractions in the British Isles, France, Italy, Germany, Switzerland and the Low Countries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Scenic views of the hot spring and volcanic regions of New Zealand in the Rotorua district including the famous pink and white terraces which were destroyed in the eruption of Mount Tarawera, June 10, 1886. There are also portraits of Maoris and views of Franz Joseph glacier.

did.physdesc: (1 item, 25 √ó 20.5 cm. Photograph album with 83 Kodak photographic postcards)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mainly of Fiji.

did.unittitle: Journeys in Persia and Kurdistan. v.p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Interleaved with descriptive text.

Cover title: Journeys in Persia and Kurdistan, by Isabella Lucy Bishop, London, 1891, is illustrated with pictures derived from these photographs. The camera work may be the work of Mrs. Bishop herself.

did.physdesc: (10 items, 22 √ó 17 cm. Mounted photographs. In a portfolio, mounted size 59 √ó 35)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographs include Villa Medici, Florence, Villa d'Este, Tivoli, Villa Borghese, Rome, and Villa Farnese, Rome.

did.unittitle: West Park tract photograph album [Los Angeles].
did.physdesc: (1 item, 14.5 √ó 20.5 cm. Photograph album with 83 photographs, mostly 12 √ó 16.5 cm.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Showing typical California bungalows of a real estate tract bounded by Normandie and Vermont Avenues, and Thirty-ninth Place, and Forty-second Street. The tract was owned by Vail & Crane. Cf. G4364 L875 1909. Vail & Crane, realtors. West Park tract [Los Angeles, ca. 1909] Map.

did.physdesc: (1 vol., 14 √ó 17.5 cm. Photograph album with 13 photographs)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: An early Tournament of Roses Parade, pre-automobile, with flower decorated carriages, wagons, and bicycles.

did.physdesc: (1 vol., 25 √ó 34 cm. Photograph album with more than 200 photographs)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photos of France, Italy, and Egypt, most of them by Alinari (Italy), Beato (Egypt), N.D. (France) and Zangaki (Egypt). Annotations indicate that the album was assembled in 1898, although the photographs were undoubtedly taken at an earlier date.

did.physdesc: (1 vol., 54 √ó 45 cm. Photograph album with photographs mounted on canvas)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Showing examples of the exteriors of French apartment houses and shops.

did.physdesc: (1 vol., 54 √ó 45 cm. Photograph album with photographs mounted on canvas)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Showing examples of the exteriors of public buildings including schools, museums, theatres, civic buildings, and the Paris Exposition of 1889. Some of the photographs are by N.D. Photographie.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Unidentified people and views.

odd.p: A negative is available of p.62.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographs of people and places in the United States, many of them in California.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographs of people and places in California, some of the places identified.

did.physdesc: (2 vol. 16 √ó 23 cm. Photograph albums with approximately 200 photographs)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Issued by Munsey. The emphasis is Southern California, but included are photographs of the Missions and other places of interest.

did.physdesc: (1 vol., 24 √ó 30 cm. with 85 mounted photographs [11 √ó 19 cm.], mounted 2 to a page)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Commercial photographs showing the Los Angeles area, Pasadena, Mt. Lowe, Redondo, and Yosemite.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographs of 45 lidded ceramic steins along with several jars and mugs. All have numbers suggesting that they belong to a collection, although there is no other identification.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The 15th century palace of the Stuarts. The photographs are identified in the plates: 4 by A.Y.; 2 by J[ames] V[alentine]; 3 by G[eorge] W[ashington] W[ilson].

did.unittitle: Italy and Italian art works. v.p. (Italy).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

did.unittitle: Santa Cruz and surroundings. Sketches from nature [Santa Cruz, California].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Probably from various sources. Included is the above title page.

did.physdesc: (1 vol. 27 √ó 23 cm. with 60 photographs mounted in an album lacking its covers)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Many are signed in the plate by James Valentine or George Washington Wilson. Included are a small group of photographs of art works.

did.unittitle: Album furr Jaeger un Jagdliebhaber. Cassel, Th. Fischer's Verlag ...

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A reference collection for a working landscape architect showing examples of pergolas, seats, and other garden structures.

did.physdesc: (1 item, 16 cm. Leather bound album with brass clasps)
(1 item. 31 √ó 25 cm. Photograph album with 57 photographs on 14 leaves)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Included are portraits of Maoris with tattooed faces, featherwork cloaks and other traditional Maori clothing, and also views of the country and the white settlers. Some of the photographs are signed Iles or J.R.

did.physdesc: (1 item. 28 √ó 38 cm. Photograph album with 43 photographs on 34 leaves)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cover title. Included are panoramic views of Melbourne, Blue Mountain, Kattomba Valley, the Great Zig-zag Railroad, and the Fish River Caves. Many photographs are signed Caney & Company, Mt. Victoria, and there is a portrait of J. Wilson from Caney & Company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views of the cathedrals facade with people posing, landscapes, street scenes, a woman either making tortillas or grinding corn over stone, water carriers with ceramic containers, independence events, and Mount Popocatepetl.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Visible file of the photos is available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bois de Boulogne (photographs of paintings by Justin Ouvri√©), ruins of St. Cloud, and a few views of unidentified chateaux.

scopecontent.p: Cover titles. The albums relate to the Paris Commune. Many of the documents are issued to James Saumarez, attach√© to the British Embassy, and suggest the albums may have been assembled by him. The photographs show the barricaded streets and damaged buildings of the city.

did.unittitle: [Collection of photographs relating to Benito Mussolini]. v.p. (Italy).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Public relations and press release photographs, unmounted, most of them showing Mussolini at state functions, making speeches, reviewing troops, etc.

did.physdesc: (40 Mounted photographs of watercolor drawings in a portfolio)

Signed in the drawing J.L.K.

did.physdesc: (75 snapshots mounted on black paper, many fading)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Scenic views of city and country life, many identified in the plate. Included is a portrait of General Porifino Diaz, President of Mexico.

did.physdesc: (Photograph album with 200 carte-de-visite portraits, bound in green Morocco with brass fittings and with monogram JA on a brass plate)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Europeans of distinction, including royalty, composers, artists, performers, and members of the Commune.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Containing family groups, some views of early automobiles, and a number of shots of 1918 Farmerettes and other girls in uniform.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Laid in is a Manuscript description of the Indian hermit, Yellow Sky.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Portraits of tribesmen and scenes of tribal activities in Northern Luzon. The album was a presentation copy from Cameron Forbes (Governor of the Philippines) to Larz Anderson (U.S. Secretary of War).
Another copy: 1 reel 35 mm. negative microfilm.

did.unittitle: Prize winning prints from Photography Magazine international picture contest. New York: Pavel Laboratories.

scopecontent.p: Prize winners are in package 1.

did.physdesc: (1 album of 12 images, identified in Manuscript)
(36 hand-colored images in a slotted album)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Country scenery, street and domestic views.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mostly wildflowers and animals. One snapshot is of Calvin Coolidge and party on a visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Family portraits, identified in Manuscript on the mounts. Names include Copeman, Spurrell, Hare and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views of native activities and island scenery.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views in Mandalay, the Mogok ruby mines, Yenangyet etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Approximately 800 images of the Los Angeles area, sepia gelatine, some Manuscript identification throughout.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Panoramic views of Rio de Janeiro including public buildings, market scenes, natural landmarks, the Corcovado railway, botanical gardens, Pao de Assucar, and Ile das Flechas.

did.unittitle: Greenfield, Ohio, public schools. William B. Inner, architect; photographs by Henry Stark. Greenfield, Ohio.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Showing Edward Lee McClain High School, Vocational School, and Elementary School, interiors and exteriors.

did.unittitle: Various South American scenes taken on the cruise of the S.S. Nieuw Amsterdam around South America.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Panoramic views of major cities in Latin America, their monuments and ancient ruins, public buildings, street scenes, and some portraits of native people.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Commercial photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Snapshots and postcards taken in France and Italy by a German soldier. A typewritten list in German identifies the images.

did.unittitle: An unidentified family of means. New York City.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Many views of Fifth Avenue Central Park, and an Aero meet at Belmont Park.

did.unittitle: Survey of Wilshire Boulevard. Los Angeles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Glossy photographs, probably used by a realtor, showing each of the buildings on Wilshire Blvd from Grand Avenue through Beverly Hills. Some volumes are interleaved with real estate information. A register is in the Collections File.

did.unittitle: Fattoria di S. Andrea in Percussina, proprieta della Eccuma pasa Elena Demidoff. Raccolta delle vedute principali relative ai danni causati del terremoto del 18 Maggio 1895.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Identified on the mounts in Manuscript. They show the destruction caused by an earthquake to the holdings of the Princess Demidoff in the small town of S. Andrea in Percussina, Italy, a few kilometers from Florence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Included are amateur snapshots of points of interest in Death Valley. The Frashers' Fotos are almost all interior views of Scotty's Castle.

did.physdesc: (Photograph album with 116 albumen prints mounted 2 to a page)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Identified in a contemporary many, many of them in Russian as well as English. Included are views of towns, bridges, the railroad, ethnic types, interiors of hospitals, churches, museums etc.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Gift of John and Carol Steinberg, 1979.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Headhunters and cannibals of the Pacific Islands and Australasia. Included also are scenes of beheading during the Shanghai riots of 1927. Nilsson, who was a unicyclist, traveled extensively.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Used to illustrate 'Snow Crystals (New York: McGraw-Hill, 1931), a work with a brief text by William Jackson Humphreys.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Most titled in the plates and signed by various photographers (C.G., Burton Brothers, Wheeler & Sons). Scenic views include the pink and white terraces which were destroyed by the eruption of Mt Tarawerea (June 10, 1886) and portraits of Maoris in native dress.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Included in vol.2 are two photographs of the Vanderbilt party on a trip down the Nile (1887), probably taken at the time the albums were assembled. Identified in Manuscript are Consuelo in her early teens, her brother Harold, and her mother, Alva Vanderbilt, later Mrs Oliver Belmont.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Ex-libris: Oliver Hazard Perry Belmont; Library of Architecture and Allied Arts.

did.unittitle: Pacific Electric Railway Company's laying of tracks. Los Angeles.

did.physdesc: (96 photographic postcards affixed in a 24-leaf slotted album, eight additional photographs laid in)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Portraits of the Dutch royal family beginning with Princess Juliana in her early teens and continuing through her wedding, World War 2, and the growing up of her children.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: From the working collection of the Library of Architecture and Allied Arts. A register of the collection is in the Collections file.

did.unittitle: Views and flowers of the Holyland. Jerusalem.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The olive wood cover, hand-carved with an inlaid border, was done by Bet Bezalel Art School, Jerusalem, and is inscribed in Hebrew: 'Gift of Talmud Torah Vi-Yeshivah Haye 'Olam.' Also included are two photographs of the school and its students.

did.unittitle: Tjandi Mission-Post and Orphanage. Dutch East Indies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Showing interior and exterior views of a Catholic mission, the brothers, and the orphans in their care.

did.physdesc: (Photograph album with 24 mounted images and two additional images laid in)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographs of ceremonial dances, pueblos, and daily life scenes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Family snapshots in and around Los Angeles[?].

did.unittitle: Views of Owens Valley and vicinity.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Stowell was a land developer whose involvement in the Owens Valley water story is the source of Harold Bell Wright's The Winning of Barbara Worth.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Gift of Mrs. George Leslie Ellsworth.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: With Manuscript identification throughout.

odd.head: General note

scopecontent.p: With typed captions in the nature of a travelogue.

did.physdesc: (1 box, 60 mounted photographs on 35 leaves - 25 leaves appear to be from one album)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Included are photographs by J.B. Sebah, H. Arnoux, Zangaki, Bonfils, and G. Lekegian.

did.unittitle: Samoa, New Zealand, Ceylon, India, and Europe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Probably collected on a tour.

did.unittitle: Portraits of early California residents. Los Angeles, San Francisco and San Jose.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Most are carte-de-visites inscribed to Dofa Chacon. A few are identified (Valentine Wolfenstein; Henri Penelon; M.A. Franklin; freaks, deformities, human curiosities).

did.unittitle: Architectural views of Los Angeles and vicinity.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Interior and exterior views of buildings interleaved with identification of the architects and building materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographed by or collected by Johnson.

These albums date from the time he worked with USGS, with some of the photographs by other USGS photographs. One album is devoted entirely to the San Francisco earthquake of 1906. A register of the collection is in the Collections files.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Johnson worked for the U.S. Geological Survey until he graduated from Stanford in 1906. Thereafter, he was consultant to various oil companies and lived in the Santa Monica area. His papers are at the University of Wyoming.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Dance of Death mural in the church at Lubeck encased in a brown cloth portfolio. Included are a photograph of the interior and one of the exterior of the church.
Boxed with 94/202 box 3.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mounted on the first leaf is a list, printed by Emily Faithfull, of the images with instructions for ordering them.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views in Los Angeles and the nearby beaches.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Many identified in the plate.

did.unittitle: Vistas de La Plata: desde su fundacion noiembre 1882 hasta junio 1884: 1. edicion. Buenos Aires (Argentina).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographs by Tomas Bradley recording the founding of La Plata, capital of the Province of Buenos Aires. Introduction in Spanish, English, French and Italian.

did.unittitle: Recuerdo del XXXII Congreso Eucaristico Internacional. Buenos Aires.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Aspects of the International Eucharistic Congress celebrated in Buenos Aires. Portraits of clergy members, military and government officials, crowds of religious followers, and views of the event.

did.unittitle: Album de photographias do Estado de Sao Paulo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Panoramic views of the city, street scenes, business areas, fagades of public buildings, churches, parks, harbors, construction of stone paved streets, fountains, markets, a military parade, railroad stations, and animals.
Identified photographer: Ganslay.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: List included.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views of Rio de Janeiro's natural landscapes, public buildings, and street scenes. An impressionistic treatment with attention to light, artistic composition, and the use of sepia and gold toning.

did.unittitle: Hermosillo, Mexico, and the Carrizal hacienda.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Panoramic views of Hermosillo, orange groves, buildings (Coliseum, Arcadia Hotel, Bank of Sonora, public market etc.), street scenes, water carriers, thrashing beans, water pumping, animals and natural landscapes.

did.unittitle: Travels of a tramp (Panama, Costa Rica and Mexico).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views of towns from the sea; street and sidewalk scenes; buildings; railroad tracks in Mexico, Costa Rica, Nicaragua and Panama, including the American Quarter in the Canal Zone.

did.unittitle: Recuerdos del Paraguay. The Paraguayan war.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Portraits of troops, cities after war, women and children as prisoners-of-war, churches, construction of a palace, railroad stations, rural areas, and a photo-reproduction of an etched boat image.
Photographs by Forni.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views of sugar plantations, street scenes, bull fights, farmhouses, oxcarts on cobbled streets, and portraits.

did.unittitle: Vistas y costumbres de la Republica Argentina.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A family photograph album with views of a cattle ranch, humorous group portraits of men and women probably related to the compiler of the album; animals, horsemen, and hounds. Possibly compiled by Cotton.
Identified photographer: Samuel Boote.

did.unittitle: Los Angeles Times Oriental excursion party.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Gift of Albert Boni, 1973 (Boni backlog no.85222).

(Photograph album with wood lacquer case, rickshaw on one side, butterfly and flowers on other, unprocessed)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: With descriptions in Dutch. Offered to the Director of the Factory, R.H. Erdman, covering his period (1904-1929).

did.physdesc: (Photograph album with 135 original photographs mounted on 17 stiff leaves)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Notes in album, including ephemera.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Signed 'Flora Moore Reed'.

did.unittitle: Photographs connected with Afghanistan collection. The Wattle Grove Press.
Trip to England and France by Eli and Esther --- of Los Angeles.
New Zealand album of a mail carrier.
Collection of photographs, including Broomland House.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Possibly during time of Paris Commune.

did.unittitle: California criminals sentenced to death by hanging.
Recuerdo de Montevideo por Bate y Ca. Montevideo[?]: Bate y Ca.
Pe√±a Chica, the Atacama Desert, and nitrate exploitation in Chile.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views of the nitrate industry in Chile: warehouses, transportation, processing plants and workers. Group portraits of businessmen, and portraits of a young man in various settings, including relatives(?) and pets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Panoramic views of Mexican cities, rural areas, natural wonders, monuments, interior view of Chapultepec Castle, bullfighting, floating garden views, flower and fruit series, and crafts.
Identified photographers: C.B. Waite, Scott, Carmichael, Cox, and Briquet.

did.unittitle: Album grafico de las visitas oficiales del gobernador constitucional del Estado de Mexico C. Carlos Riva Palacio.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Palacio's official visits to cities and towns of the state of Mexico as governor. Many group portraits of the governor and supporters at political events.
Photographs by Laborde.

did.unittitle: Brazil - Various rural and urban scenes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Panoramic views of Rio de Janeiro, Sao Paulo, Pernambuco, Bahia, Porto Alegre and other cities, rural areas and landscapes, portraits of Bahian types and Indians, and Sao Paulo's railroad tracks and viaducts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Taken in France and Belgium.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Panoramic views of various towns related to the banana trade, ox carts transporting bananas, sea shore storage, banana ship, and group portraits of men and soldiers.

did.unittitle: Scenic views along the Mexican National Railroad tracks.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views of monuments, historical sites, and street scenes of cities and countryside, including San Antonio, Texas.

did.unittitle: Mexican generals, clergy members, women and children who may be related to General Paz Alvarez family.
did.physdesc: (Photograph album with 98 carte de visite portraits)

did.unittitle: Mexican centennial events and inauguration of President Alvaro Obregon.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Portraits of President Alvaro Obregon and members of his cabinet, views of events during the centennial celebration, the military parade, traditional dances, cultural and political activities, and the people's participation.
Identified photographer: Sosa y Diaz.

did.unittitle: Various scenes of Rio de Janeiro. Rio de Janeiro: Maison Chic.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views of Rio de Janeiro, including public buildings, main avenues, street scenes with electric cars and mule carts, and views from the Pao D'Assucar cable car.

did.unittitle: Vues de Rio de Janeiro, Bresil (Rio de Janeiro: Le Musso & Cia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Portrait of President Nilo Pecanha and cabinet members, views of government buildings, major avenues and streets, plazas, panoramic view of the city towards the ocean, the botanical garden and the Tijuca waterfall.

did.unittitle: Brazil, including Sao Paulo, Santos, Guaruja.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Panoramic views of Santos, Sao Paulo, monuments, public cultural buildings, tea harvesting, orange and coffee plantations, and aspects of coffee production.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Including urban and rural views of Guadalajara, Mexico City and other locations.
Views of rural scenes (women washing clothes, water carriers); street scenes, portraits, religious buildings, Chapultepec Castle, statues, missions and diverse views of towns.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Views of] Rio de Janeiro.

did.unittitle: Consejo Nacional de Educacion (Argentina). Vistas de escuelas comunes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views of public schools' fagades and interiors, portraits of school children in classrooms and children from military school.
Identified photographer: Samuel Boote.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 19th century photographs of Argentina and Chile, including Tierra del Fuego.

did.unittitle: Vistas del camino de La Oroya a la montana de Chanchamayo: photograph album of Peru (Lima y Callao: Colville & Cia, s.a.).
Guanajuato en el ano de mil novecientos treinta y siete. Mexico.
Photo album of Banana industry in Costa Rica.
S. Charles Lee's Los Angeles Theater.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views of the interior of the theater, including the auditorium, lounges, foyer, children's playroom and details of furniture and interior decoration.

did.unittitle: Cananea, Sonora, Mexico, and Ray, Arizona.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views of Cananea, the mines, mass meetings, railroads, baseball team and many informal family pictures. Also one blueprint of Ray, Arizona, taken before the fire of 1912.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Many views of Whittier and C.W. Leffingwell's ranch, including buildings, relatives and friends.
Also, views of Santa Monica, Mount Lowe, Catalina, Long Beach, La Fiesta de Las Flores, 1902 Tournament of Roses, Kern County, Bakersfield, San Bernardino, Riverside, Redondo Beach and Los Angeles.

did.physdesc: (Photograph album with 68 images including 5 panoramic views)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views include the Pala Reservation, the San Diego Flume, the San Luis Rey Valley, and general views of irrigation and redwood trees.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Many views of the Hagan family and their home, together with views of the Los Angeles area, including the Elks parades of the 1890s, and Pasadena.
Also there are views of Northfield, Minnesota, Colorado, Honolulu, Salt Lake City and Saltair on the Great Salt Lake.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The town of Blumenau in Brazil, including a panorama of the town, and views of the river, streets, buildings, churches and railway station.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views of city streets, churches, hotels, and theaters. Also views of the outskirts of the city and of country houses round Sao Paulo. Most views ca 1860, with one from 1887.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views of the Cuban countryside, Santiago and its harbor, Havana and its harbor, including the wreck of the USS Maine, and theaters, plazas, buildings, and the cathedral in Havana.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views of the towns and cities and countryside of Palestine. Many views of the gates, walls and streets of Jerusalem.
Also views of Bethlehem, Nazareth, Galilee and Capernum.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Includes] 2 hand-colored of an unidentified American family.

did.physdesc: (Photograph album with 86 images, 2 hand-colored, fine leather binding with metalwork decoration on front)

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Gift of Mr. George W. Schuyler.

did.physdesc: (Photograph album with 347 images, sizes vary from 3.5 √ó 2.25" to 11 √ó 8.5")

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views of the south of England, including the Isle of Wight, Scotland, Wales and Ireland.
Also, views of France,Belgium, Holland, Germany, Switzerland and Italy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The old Charter House hospital founded by Thomas Sutton for the poor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Men and women involved in the French commune. Everyone is named, and the fate of many of them is also listed.

did.physdesc: (6 vol. of photograph albums, photographs mounted on linen and of various sizes)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Including Grant, Rosecrans, Sherman, etc. Most were published by E. & H.T. Anthony.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Albums are part of group collected by Albert Boni.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views of Australia (Melbourne, Adelaide, Perth, Kalgoorlie), Sri Lanka (Colombo), Egypt (Port Said and the Suez Canal), Italy (Pompeii and Naples), France (Marseilles), England (Brighton, Chatham, Rochester, Ascot, Epsom, Newton Abbott, Portsmouth, Southampton), Ireland (Dublin, Blarney, Clonakilty, Miltown), and Scotland.

did.physdesc: (Photograph album with 150 images, all approximately 16.5 √ó 13 cm.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views primarily of the floating gardens of Xochimilco outside Mexico City, including its markets, boats, and restaurants.
There are also views of a small country bull ring, bulls being raised for the ring, and an hacienda.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: From the estate of Urie McCleary.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A few of the identified notables.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Published by E. & H.T. Anthony.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Issued as a souvenir with title of play and name of theatre on binding.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Album and cartes imprinted D. Appleton.

did.physdesc: (22 albumen prints, size either approximately 9.5 √ó 7" or 13.5 √ó 10", Mounted 20.75 √ó 14")

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views include the Bay of Naples, Pompeii, St. Peter's Square in Rome, Florence and various statuary.

did.physdesc: (Photograph album with 43 images, all approximately 30 √ó 26 cm.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Aerial views of the River Thames, principal bridges over the river, important landmarks along the river and central London.
Also, views of Stepney in East London, including the brewery and several streets.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: From the estate of Urie McCleary.

did.physdesc: (12.5 √ó 10" Photograph album with 61 images, all approximately 7 √ó 8.5")

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views in and around Buenos Aires, including the port, casa del gobierno, customs house, Palermo, the Recoleta, La Boca, Corrales, stations and churches.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographs taken by teenage son of Dr. and Mrs. Bridge[?].
Includes views on board the S.S. St. Louis, and of France, Switzerland, Italy and Germany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes views of the Japanese countryside agricultural workers, sumo wrestling tournament, Kyoto and Yokohama.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views at time of theater's opening, of the ticket office, entrance, foyer, furniture, auditorium, lounges, powder rooms and exterior with searchlights.

did.physdesc: (3 vol. of 7.5 √ó 10" Photograph albums with 108 images, 3.5 √ó 4.5-5.5")

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views include Lima, Ancon, Chorillos, along the line of the Central railway from Lima to La Oroya and the Cerro de Pasco Railway from La Oroya to Cerro de Pasco, and towns and countryside in Pasco and Huanuco departments.
Glage appears to have worked at the smelter at La Fundicion.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views include Point Fermin, Long Beach, Mojave Desert, Lancaster, Pasadena, Ocean Park, Venice, Antelope Valley, Balboa Beach, Laguna Beach, Torrey Pines, the 1920 Rose parade, and various family beach scenes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views include the early weeks of the Manzanar War Relocation Center, Monterey Presidio, Seattle, Inglewood, California, army training camp, tanks, various parts of California, and family snapshots.
Also includes Durbin's 1946 commission into the U.S. Army Corps.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes views of the Southwest Junior Rifle Club, automobile racing in the Los Angeles area, and shooting and automobile racing ephemera.

did.physdesc: (11 √ó 16" Photograph album with 613 photographs, 7 prints, and 3 maps on 69 leaves - majority of images 3.5 √ó 5.5")

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Almost all images are snapshots taken by owner of album, and all are clearly labeled. Views are of both various kinds of mining as well as of cities and countryside and are especially strong on Chile (179 photographs), Guianas (139 photographs) and Peru (93 photographs).
Also includes pictures of Argentina, Brazil, Bolivia, Uruguay, Panama, Trinidad, U.S. Virgin Islands and New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views include Bilicke mansion site in South Pasadena before construction, construction of building, house and estate after completion, many with Bilicke's children featured, and snapshots of Bilicke children, many in fancy dress at "Camp Harvard."

did.physdesc: (7.25 √ó 11.5" Photograph album with 259 images on 100pp., photos range in size from 2 √ó 2.5" to 4 √ó 6")

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes many family snapshots, as well as views of Brawley, Indio, Holtville, Cuyamarca, the San Diego zoo, and many rural locations around San Diego and Imperial counties.

did.physdesc: (7 √ó 11.25" Photograph album with 289 images on 100pp., photographs approximately 2.5 √ó 3.5")

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Snapshots of Rose Lane, her friends, sister and family[?]. Taken in various locations in Virginia, Kentucky, Ohio and Tennessee.
Also, views of Washington, D.C. from a trip in 1921.

did.unittitle: Africa's Legacy: Photographs in Brazil and Peru.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 43 images from Peru and 40 images from Brazil, each with own title page and preface. The pictures of Peru were taken in Chincha and Lima between 1985 and 1986, and the pictures of Brazil were taken in the Northeast in 1995 and 1996.
Pictures are of everyday life of the poor.

did.unittitle: Los Angeles Chamber of Commerce Excursion to the Islands of Hawaii.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes views of group leaving San Pedro, en route to Hawaii, at various locations around the islands, and leaving the islands.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes views of Nome and St. Michael, as well as scenes from everyday life in and around western Alaska. Also, views of mines and mining, railroads, ships, the seashore, eskimos[?], and dogs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views of buildings, trees and river in Augsburg.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sequence of photographs shows WAVES (Women Accepted for Voluntary Emergency Service) from visiting recruiting office, through induction, training, social life, and going on parade, to passing out of training college.

did.unittitle: Vitoria, in the state of Espirito Santo, Brazil.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views of the city. Many pairs of views comparing scenes before and after improvements have been made. Most photographs captioned. Some hand-painted decoration.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 21 photographs signed by Abel Briquet.
Views include several city views of Mexico City, Puebla, Zacatecas, Tacubaya and other cities, as well as many of the countryside, showing peasants at work and at their homes.
Also, 9 photos of pre-colonial statuary.

did.physdesc: (8.5 √ó 10.5" Photograph album with 177 photographs and 2 postcards)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 110 views of Colombia, especially of Baranquilla, the Magdalena River and the emerald mines at Chivor.
Also, 46 views of Norway, including Stavanger and Sand; rural England, Martinique and St. Tropez, France.
With "Lecture on South America" by an anonymous author on his trip to Colombia and his experiences in the emerald mines, February 1, 1927 (15pp. typescript).

did.unittitle: Photograph album of Rio de Janeiro

otherfindaid.p: See the OAC record for this photograph album: Photograph album of Rio de Janeiro

did.unittitle: Photograph album of views of the Ferrocarril Central from Callao to Chicla, Peru
Venezuelan vistas : Spanish American life, and some notes on a year in Caracas, the capital city of Venezuela

did.physdesc: (1 vol., 32 √ó 39 cm. Photograph album with approximately 30 [19 √ó 24 cm.] mounted photographs)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cover title. Depicts a country estate in Scotland with views of the house, the grounds, and various scenes of a deer hunt.

did.physdesc: (1 vol., 32 √ó 43 cm. Photograph album with various size albumen prints)

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: See the OAC record for this photograph album: Photograph album of views of Scotland
Scenery and historical interiors, most of the photographs initialed in the plate, J.V., the binding gold-stamped J. Valentine Photographer, Dundee.
